column4: hi, I just installed an ftp server on ubuntu. everything works fine inside my LAN, but accessing it from outside is very slow (and  sometimes does not work). Other services like sshfs etc works fine. Any settings I could do besides opening port 21 in my firewall?
FTP works on ports 20 and 21 if I'm not mistaken
So the FTP server works fine on your LAN, but goes slow when going through your firewall?
I'm trying to mount the ftp (mount -t ftp) under os x, but it refuses most of the time.. I can ftp in to it through the shell though.
Can you mount the ftp server via the Finder?
I forgot where that menu option is in OS X.
What kind of firewall/router are you using?
Could this possibly be because I'm trying to access it through the Internet from inside the LAN?
I can vaguely remember hearing something about problems with port forwards when you try them from inside the lan.
I'm not quite sure on accessing your external IP like that.... I did it a few weeks back with a ventrilo server and had no problems
You verified your internal IP on your FTP server and make sure it didn't change? (I'm assuming you're running DHCP on your LAN)
I have reserved a range for serverish computers
Ah, okay. Port forwarding on ports 20 and 21 for the ftp server?
